channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why the first Fed rate cut in nine months would likely extend the stock market’s rally

item.title: ‘I learned a hard lesson’: My ex-husband gambled away our $900,000 life savings. Do I use my 401(k) to buy a home?
item.description: “I have about $80,000 in my 401(k) and $10,000 in savings.”

item.title: Apple is blowing its chance for AI leadership — but what else would you expect?
item.description: Apple no longer innovates —instead, it waits. And with AI, anyone playing it safe will get left behind.

item.title: Bitcoin has surrendered the rally. Why it didn’t bounce after a whale unloaded the cryptocurrency.
item.description: A whale sold a chunk of bitcoin over the weekend, and on Monday, the cryptocurrency was dragging the rest of the sector south.

item.title: Small-cap stocks surged on Friday — and now, they’ve finally busted out of a range
item.description: Hard-hit small-cap stocks may finally have their day in the Sun.

item.title: Developers lose focus 1,200 times a day — how MCP could change that
item.description: One of the most impactful applications of MCP is its ability to connect AI coding assistants directly to developer tools.

item.title: OpenCUA’s open source computer-use agents rival proprietary models from OpenAI and Anthropic
item.description: The open source framework provides the data and training recipe for building powerful computer-use agents that challenge proprietary systems.

item.title: Busted by the em dash — AI’s favorite punctuation mark, and how it’s blowing your cover
item.description: AI is brilliant at polishing and rephrasing. But like a child with glitter glue, you still need to supervise it.
